Subsection.Text: A person may file with the Department of State a correction statement with respect to a judgment lien file, as provided in s. 55.203, indexed under any person’s name, if the person believes that the file is inaccurate or that the judgment lien certificate was wrongfully filed.

Paragraph.Text: State the judgment debtor named and the file number assigned to the judgment lien file to which the correction statement relates;
Indicate that it is a correction statement;
Provide the basis for the person’s belief that the judgment lien certificate was wrongfully filed or the file is inaccurate; and
Indicate the manner in which the person believes the file should be corrected to cure any inaccuracy.

Subsection.Text: The department shall ensure that a correction statement is indexed and available in the same manner as any filed lien certificate in the central database of judgment lien files.
The filing of a correction statement does not affect the effectiveness of the judgment lien or other filing.
